data.title: Can't get cuda encoding working
data.meta_description: I've reinstalled XP 3 or 4 times and updated to the newest driver but I can't get cuda encoding working. I've tried using cuda.exe in Hydra and from commandline with Virtualdub's external encoder feature. I've tried using different versions of Mediacoder which supports cuda encoding with CudaH264Enc...
data.text:
Author

DarrellS011

New Member

Total Posts : 4

Reward points : 0

Joined:

Status: offline

Ribbons : 0

I've reinstalled XP 3 or 4 times and updated to the newest driver but I can't get cuda encoding working. I've tried using cuda.exe in Hydra and from commandline with Virtualdub's external encoder feature. I've tried using different versions of Mediacoder which supports cuda encoding with CudaH264Enc but I am having no luck at all. I'm pretty sure that I was able to use Mediacoder in the past but it will not work now.

I have an EVGA GTS450 on a Gigabyte EP35-DS3P with a Q6600 CPU and 4GB of G.SKIL DDR2 1066 memory.

What would cause cuda not to work and is there a program that I can use to see if it is working and force it to work if it is not working?

I wasn't getting an error with Mediacoder before, it just kept jumping to the x264 encoder but after reinstalling the newest version I got a pop window saying that something was blocking the Cuda thread and asked me if I wanted to continue. Cuda.exe always crashes at the same point with Hydra and Virtualdub when cuda is called to start encoding.

I really don't know what to do besides installing XP again but it's becoming a tiresome task and not fixing the problem. I've installed all the VB redistributables and net framework versions.

Re:Can't get cuda encoding working (permalink)

I was using the latest driver from NVIDIA 314.22 and the latest driver from EVGA 314.07 but I downloaded the cuda toolkit last night to get the driver that should work with cuda, 306.94 but it was a no go.

The error from virtualdub with the cuda.exe CLI was...

Error: The video encoding process has prematurely exited with an error code of -1073741819 (c0000005)

The error from Hybrid with cuda.exe was...

2013.04.02 - 04:54:51_Windows XP-32bit_2013.02.16.1 - -> 04_54_24_5410_01_video crashed:main send out an error: QProcess::Crashed

2013.04.02 - 04:54:51_Windows XP-32bit_2013.02.16.1 - MAIN CALL CRASHED: main send out an error: QProcess::Crashed

Mediacoder: The encoding thread seems to be blocked. If you are not running other program that comsumes all CPU time, this may indicate that the encoder has encountered an error and stopped and stopped working. There is no other error.

When I click on the Mediacoder folder in program files, Windows Explorer crashes.

I'm going to go ahead and do one more fresh install of XP SP2 without installing any other programs or updates and go from there. I keep getting everything so cluttered up that I'll never be able to figure this out.

Re:Can't get cuda encoding working (permalink)

Reinstalled Windows XP SP2. Installed MB drivers. Installed EVGA driver off of Installation disk (260.63 I believe). Downloaded Hybrid.7z and tried to run Hybrid.exe. It crashed instantly (I think you have to install VB 2010 to cure that). Open Virtualdub from my unzipped folder and directed the external encoder to the cuda.exe file in the Hybrid folder and clicked save to encode the video, expecting a crash and to my surprise, it encoded a 219MB video using the cuda encoder in 38 seconds. :)

It wasn't quite as fast as I thought it would be at 188fps but from the command line, I guess it was expected. I guess I can go ahead and install my printer, scanner and graphics tablet and all my programs and drivers. I don't think I'll install SP3 or any updates.

If anyone is interested in using the external encoder feature in Virtualdub to encode H264 with cuda, there is a thread on the Virtualdub forums to teach you how to create the encoder sets.

You can download the Hybrid program from Videohelp or Selur's website

Open Virtualdub abd under optios, select external encoders

Create a new encoder Profile: (cuda)

Type: video encoder

Programm: Path to Cuda.exe

Command arguments: --resolution %(width)x%(height) --input - --sar 1x1 --format YV12 --control_mode cq --fps %(fps) --profile high --level auto --offload partial --measure FPS --showFrameStats 100 --deinterlace true --frame_typ frame --pframe_dist 1 --gop_max 250 --dynamicGOP true --pquant_min 12 --bquant_min 15 --iquant_min 10 --deblock true --cavlc false --nal_typ auto --sps_pps false --slices auto --output "%(tempvideofile)"

Output filename: %(outputname)

Launch parameters: all enabled

Create a new Encoder set: (cuda)

Video encoder: the profile you just created (cuda)

File description: 264

File extension: 264

To encode the video: File -> Export -> Using external encoders -> select the just created encoder set -> click Ok -> enter output name + Save

Re:Can't get cuda encoding working (permalink)

Do yourself a favor, set a RESTORE point.. now while everything is working.

Then do NOT put everything back in at once.

Setup a very small 30sec render for testing, then put things back in slowly! One or two at a time and reboot after each install.

Run the test render after items are installled and the computer has been rebooted.

This should give you a known recovery point and help point out "where' problems occur

Re:Can't get cuda encoding working (permalink)

I'm no expert on this stuff but I use Powerdirector 9 occasionally which uses CUDA to great effect. Last time I went to use it, it was working extremely slow... almost unusable. Turns out every NVidia driver after 301.42 doesn't allow CUDA to work with that software. (of course Cyberlink released a patch for PD10 & 11 but not 9 leaving me out in the weeds if I wanted to use a Kepler card and still get the CUDA benefits with the program... but that's another story! )

Anyway, I went back to that driver (301.42) and back to the speed I came to know and love. Might be worth a try.
